title: Drawing, "Designs for Two Toilet Boxes", ca. 1805
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and watercolor on paper
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: A toilet box, with lid open is shown in isometric projection. Below, lid, with painted lozenge with motif of Cupid’s head, bow and quiver. Right, another box shown in plan, and below, the lid with oval medallion of a standing vessel.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Designs for Two Toilet Boxes", ca. 1805.
ca. 1805. Pen and black ink, brush and watercolor on paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-484.
